title: 6 Entry level computer science graduate jobs in Australia | Glassdoor

extracted_data.title: 6 Entry level computer science graduate jobs in Australia
extracted_data.main_content:
We power insights for better, safer workplaces…together.
Kickstart your Tech Career: Junior Software Developer (Open to new Graduates and multiple roles available).
Are you a recent graduate ready to dive into the world of software development? Do you have a passion for coding, problem-solving, and continuous learning? We’re on the hunt for motivated individuals like you to join our team!
We are seeking a dynamic and recently graduated Software Developer. As a Junior Software Developer, you will support the design, development, and maintenance of our software solutions. This role offers a fantastic chance to grow your technical skills while working closely with experienced developers. You'll be part of a collaborative team, contributing your creativity and fresh perspective to build and maintain reliable, high-quality cloud-based SaaS products that meet customer needs and business objectives.
OUR TEAM’S STRENGTH COMES FROM EVERYONE’S INDIVIDUALITY
About you:
- Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
- Experience: Previous internship or entry-level experience is a plus, along with a portfolio of coding projects.
- Technical Skills: Proficiency in relevant programming languages and familiarity with development frameworks (e.g. C#, Typescript/JavaScript, React, NodeJS, Flutter). A willingness to learn new frameworks and technologies to bring great products to market.
- Tools: Basic knowledge of software development tools and version control systems (e.g., Git).
- Methodologies: Understanding of Agile principles and the Scrum framework, along with a willingness to skill up in DevOps practices.
- Mindset: Strong desire to learn and grow in the software development field, with a continuous learning mindset.
DELIVERING THE GOOD, STRIVING FOR THE GREAT
Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Software Development:
- Assist in designing, coding, testing, and debugging software applications based on technical specifications.
- Write clean, efficient, and scalable code that meets project requirements.
- Help maintain and improve existing systems, resolving issues to support smooth business operations.
Technical Analysis:
- Collaborate with team members to analyse user needs and software requirements.
- Participate in technical discussions, contributing ideas for potential improvements and innovative solutions.
Collaboration:
- Work closely with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and senior developers, to deliver integrated software solutions.
- Communicate effectively to ensure clarity on project goals and tasks.
Problem-Solving:
- Help identify and address software defects and performance issues.
- Assist in debugging and resolving technical challenges in a timely manner.
Continuous Improvement:
- Stay updated on emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices.
- Apply new knowledge to enhance the development process and contribute to delivering cutting-edge solutions.
Documentation & Code Review:
- Contribute to creating clear technical documentation, including design specifications and user guides.
- Participate in code reviews, offering and receiving constructive feedback to ensure code quality.
ARE YOU READY TO BE A KINATICAN?
Where our passion, talent, delivery and impact collide our purpose lies. Powering insights for better, safer workplaces, helping organisations to know their people – we are a global leader in Reg-Tech. Our technology helps organisations to know their people.
- Flexible and supportive work environment
- A culture of development and recognition, we want our people to thrive!
- Attend our Friday Funaticans in person and virtual events
- Bright, spacious office in the Perth CBD
- Work for an ASX listed company and a leader in Reg-Tech
TELL US ABOUT YOURSELF
Apply with your resume (with cover letter appreciated).
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised individuals tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes (a growth mindset) but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.
